channel.title: [IMPORTANT]How to spot a real jagex e-mail from a phising one.[IMPORTANT]
channel.description:
of coarse jagex has posted a really detailed guide on how to spot them.
I will sum it up.
fake e-mail: [IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/24m5383.png[/img]
Effects that will happen if you click one (they're really smart cause they can send it to you while you're waiting for an e-mail confirmation): [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/kevtw7.jpg[/img]
Real runescape: [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/2i6j6m0.png[/img]
As said on rs, rs always uses (whatever it is)@runescape.com
Just bringing this to your attention, just because these people are extremely good at masking themselves like jagex.
[b]tips:[/b] 1. Jagex uses html (and/or php idk) in they're e-mails. 2. Use browsers like mozilla firefox and google chrome that protect you against forgery type sites. 3. Always hover over the url, and check it for security coders like runescape (GB) (taken from one of the tips a user said)
Like/Hate, I don't care. EDIT:
[quote="Chassy13"]I was browsing through the news articles and they addressed this issue just recently. Apparently the senders don't actually know the people play RS - they just generate a large number of emails and send them out.
Source: [url=http://services.runescape.com/m=news/phishing-emails--how-to-stay-safe]http://services.runescape.com/m=news/phishing-emails--how-to-stay-safe[/url][/quote] EDIT/added: Tips from other players: [quote="Andrew Ferguson"]They can fake the address they send it from, the only sure way is to hover over the url and see the real url it's sending you too in the message.[/quote] [quote="jmood128"]Also look at the address bar of the link.... runescape has a green bar that says Jagex Limited (GB) if you don't see this then that is a phishing site.[/quote] [quote="baddy351"]Honestly, the best way to spot phishing sites is to use google chrome, right click, and view the source code. If there is anything in there that save to a file, then do /file.extension after the url. if there is anything there, then it is phishing (normal source wont have anything like this ;))[/quote] [quote="Demon6994"]You go to the link they provide Look at thr URL bar.... AND IT WONT SAY RUNESCAPE It'll say something like runescope.com <--- That's how you know it's a pishing site. :) Everytime I was reported for something, and it got solved, I never recieved and e-mail anyways. :) They always messaged it to me threw runescape.com when you log in. :P They message you on the site, not threw e-mail litterally. :P[/quote] [quote="Spades"]Or you can just hover over the link or copy link location to see that the provided link is just a cover of a real link.[/quote]

[/quote]

Maybe cause you requested it.

item.title: [IMPORTANT]How to spot a real jagex e-mail from a phising one.[IMPORTANT]
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:31, topic:419167”]They should just do what WoW does and say

“When Blizzard emails you we will NOT include a link, safely access the World of Warcraft website yourself and go into the User CP”[/quote]

rs should do that, I agree 100% with it, I do admit i played WoW until cataclysm came out, their e-mail system about that rule was very good in those terms.

Read full topic

item.title: [IMPORTANT]How to spot a real jagex e-mail from a phising one.[IMPORTANT]
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:29, topic:419167”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=521694.msg3792879#msg3792879 date=1319415219]
Actually, some emails you get from jagex aren’t fake.

I decided to go back to RS because of the bot MEGA-BANHAMMER, and I couldn’t remember my password. This is a real email, I’m playing on my account now. However, if you look at the top right corner of the image, you can see the second email I have gotten was with a fake email.
[/quote]Which I meant email verification (password recoveries). :D[/quote]

exactly, but seriously, it’s fucking annoying, maybe theres an option for your e-mail that you can allot certain people to send e-mails to you.

Read full topic

item.title: [IMPORTANT]How to spot a real jagex e-mail from a phising one.[IMPORTANT]

item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

How many times have I heard this: Jagex won’t send you anything relating to your ACTUAL account. If its banned, its via message box. Loyalty, and email verification is all they send.

Read full topic

item.title: [IMPORTANT]How to spot a real jagex e-mail from a phising one.[IMPORTANT]

item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

ytuio9`:

I don’t understand how they’re getting the e-mails. i even got a few e-mails for world of warcraft…

I was browsing through the news articles and they addressed this issue just recently. Apparently the senders don’t actually know the people play RS - they just generate a large number of emails and send them out.

Source: http://services.runescape.com/m=news/phishing-emails–how-to-stay-safe

Read full topic
